item.title: 科克风暴引发暴雨，巴黎东部发出洪水警报
item.description: 飓风 "柯克 "的残余给法国北部带来暴雨，巴黎以东的塞纳-马恩省已进入洪水红色预警状态。【原文：France’s Seine-et-Marne, just east of Paris, is on red alert for flooding after the remnants of Hurricane Kirk brought heavy rain across the north of the country.】

item.title: EDF 寻求筹集多达 40 亿英镑的资金帮助英国欣克利核电站的建设
item.description: 法国电力公司（Electricite de France SA）正在与投资者就英国欣克利角 C 核电站的资金问题进行谈判，因为法国电力公司正在努力解决项目成本膨胀的问题。【原文：Electricite de France SA is holding talks with investors over funding for the Hinkley Point C nuclear power plant under construction in the UK, as the French utility grapples with the ballooning cost of the project.】

item.title: 飓风米尔顿的最新情况
item.description: 10 月 9 日，佛罗里达州迈尔斯堡萨拉索塔地区一条被洪水淹没的街道。摄影师：Joe Raedle/Getty Images【原文：A flooded street in the Sarasota area in Fort Myers, Florida, on Oct. 9. Photographer: Joe Raedle/Getty Images】

item.title: COP29 一切向钱看为战斗做好准备
item.description:
"受益者和付出者是不同的，"美洲开发银行气候变化特别顾问阿维纳什-佩尔绍德（Avinash Persaud）在本周的Zero节目中说道。【原文：

“The people who benefit and the people who pay are different,” says Avinash Persaud, special adviser on climate change, Inter-American Development Bank, on this week’s episode of Zero.

】

item.title: 如何结束碳捕集的拉锯战
item.description:
气候倡导者陷入了技术是有益还是有害的争论。【原文：

Climate advocates are stuck in debates over whether the technology helps or harms. The better question is who should pay for it?

】

item.title: 在伦敦机场，工党的经济和绿色雄心发生冲突
item.description: 伦敦城市机场是通往英国首都金融区的重要枢纽，当工党批准在该机场增加航班时，这最终成为了一个折中的决定，最终谁也不满意。【原文：When the Labour Party approved more flights at London City Airport, a key hub for travelers to the UK capital’s financial districts, it ended up being a compromise decision that ultimately pleased no one.】

item.title: 米尔顿 "飓风登陆佛罗里达州，具有 "危险性和破坏性
item.description: 飓风 "米尔顿 "以 3 级风暴登陆，英国气象局警告说，飓风将具有 "危险性和破坏性"，数千名英国度假者飞往佛罗里达州的航班被取消。【原文：Hurricane Milton has made landfall as a Category 3 storm, with the Met Office warning it will be "dangerous and destructive" as thousands of UK holidaymakers had flights to Florida cancelled.】

item.title: 煤炭扩张有助于吸引保险公司重返生产商白港
item.description: 澳大利亚最大的煤炭生产商之一怀特黑文煤炭有限公司（Whitehaven Coal Ltd.）在找到愿意承担风险的外部保险公司后，搁置了原计划用于提供内部保险的特殊目的载体。【原文：Whitehaven Coal Ltd., one of Australia’s largest coal producers, shelved a planned special purpose vehicle originally intended to provide in-house insurance after finding external insurers willing to take on the risk.】

item.title: 飓风米尔顿携强风登陆佛罗里达州
item.description: 飓风 "米尔顿 "以摧枯拉朽之势猛烈袭击了佛罗里达州坦帕附近的西海岸，将一堵水墙推向海岸，使这一人口稠密地区的生命受到威胁。【原文：Hurricane Milton slammed into Florida’s west coast near Tampa with tree-snapping winds, pushing a wall of water onshore and putting lives at risk in the densely populated region.】

item.title: 英国为可再生能源发电项目提供资金支持
item.description: 英国政府正在启动一项新的资助计划，以释放对长期储能的投资，这是其推动优化可再生能源扩张的关键部分。【原文：The UK government is launching a new funding program to unlock investment in long duration storage, a key part of its drive to optimize the expansion of renewable energy.】

item.title: 为什么风暴潮不会被归入飓风米尔顿的类别
item.description:
海水水位的上升会带来危险的洪水，但传播危险的系统却变得更加复杂。【原文：

Rising seawater levels can bring dangerous flooding, but the system to communicate the danger has gotten more complex.

】

item.title: 海伦飓风后，以佛罗里达州为重点的保险公司面临米尔顿风险
item.description: 在飓风 "海伦 "袭击佛罗里达州两周之后，飓风 "米尔顿 "又一次袭击了该州的墨西哥湾沿岸地区。【原文：Florida-focused insurers are set to face further strain as Hurricane Milton bears down on the state’s Gulf Coast just two weeks after Helene battered the region.】

item.title: 气候变化如何助长飓风的危险路径
item.description:
飓风米尔顿穿过墨西哥湾的东部轨迹非常罕见，但随着海洋变暖，更多的风暴可能会带来不可预测的影响。【原文：

Hurricane Milton’s eastern trajectory through the Gulf of Mexico is rare, but as oceans warm, more storms may have unpredictable impacts.

】

item.title: 加拿大绿色分类不可能包括新的天然气站点
item.description: 加拿大更加明确了它所认为的本土绿色投资；新的天然气项目不太可能入选。【原文：Canada has provided more clarity on what it considers to be homegrown green investments — with new natural gas projects unlikely to make the cut.】

item.title: 飓风米尔顿威胁佛罗里达州 300 亿美元市政债务
item.description: 根据彭博情报公司（Bloomberg Intelligence）的分析，飓风米尔顿正向佛罗里达州袭来，威胁着坦帕湾地区的大规模风暴潮，大约 300 亿美元的市政债务面临风险。【原文：As Hurricane Milton barrels toward Florida threatening massive storm surges in the Tampa Bay area, roughly $30 billion of municipal debt is at risk, according to an analysis from Bloomberg Intelligence.】

item.title: 拜登称特朗普在密尔顿接近海岸时散布 "彻头彻尾的谎言
item.description: 乔-拜登总统批评唐纳德-特朗普及其共和党盟友在联邦应对接连发生的飓风问题上 "赤裸裸地撒谎"，称政府正在竭尽全力帮助受灾社区。【原文：President Joe Biden criticized Donald Trump and his Republican allies for what he said were “outright lies” about the federal response to back-to-back hurricanes, saying the administration was doing everything it could to help impacted communities.】

item.title: 敦促六百万佛罗里达人逃离米尔顿即将到来的暴风雪
item.description:
距离大飓风登陆还有几个小时，德桑蒂斯说，在各城市做好准备应对飓风影响的同时，仍有时间进行疏散。【原文：

With landfall by the major hurricane hours away, DeSantis says there is still time to evacuate as cities brace for impact.

】

item.title: 飓风 "米尔顿 "在登陆之前就已经重塑了风暴科学
item.description:
为了预测 "爆炸性 "风暴，飓风科学家需要大量数据来为更新的模型提供信息。【原文：

To predict “explosive” storms, hurricane scientists need an ocean of data to feed into newer models.

】

item.title: 大贸易商的可持续作物计划因欧盟的拖延而泡汤
item.description: 欧盟推迟实施禁止进口与砍伐森林有关的农作物的规定，这给大型贸易商为满足新需求而制定已久的计划带来了动荡。【原文：The European Union’s move to delay of rules that would ban the import of crops linked to deforestation is creating upheaval for big traders’ long-set plans to meet the new demand.】

item.title: 飓风 "米尔顿 "吹袭佛罗里达坦帕地区，摧毁房屋
item.description: 飓风米尔顿带着足以摧毁房屋的强风向佛罗里达州西海岸袭来，有可能在该州一些发展最快的县引发百年一遇的洪灾。【原文：Hurricane Milton churned toward Florida’s west coast with winds powerful enough to demolish houses, threatening to unleash once-in-a-century flooding across some of the state’s fastest-growing counties.】

item.title: Northvolt 被告知 15 亿美元贷款担保遥不可及
item.description: 瑞典国债办公室已排除启动为 Northvolt AB 提供的 15 亿美元信贷担保的可能性。【原文：Sweden’s National Debt Office has ruled out activating $1.5 billion in credit guarantees for Northvolt AB that were tied to a now-halted expansion of the battery manufacturer’s main factory.】

item.title: 再保险公司为历史性损失做好准备
item.description: 飓风 "米尔顿 "目前预计将于周四早些时候登陆，它可能成为有史以来最大的再保险损失之一。今天的时事通讯将探讨潜在的后果。【原文：Hurricane Milton, which is now expected to make landfall early Thursday, may rank among the largest-ever reinsurance losses. Today’s newsletter looks at the potential fallout.】

item.title: 项目匮乏减缓了南非 93 亿美元的煤炭退出计划
item.description: 南非总统府表示，由于缺乏可投资的项目，南非与世界上一些最富有的国家签订的价值 93 亿美元的气候融资协议的实施工作进展缓慢。【原文：The implementation of a $9.3 billion climate-finance pact between South Africa and some of the world’s richest nations has been slowed by an absence of investable projects, the African country’s presidency said.】

item.title: 联邦防洪图不敌佛罗里达双重飓风
item.description:
许多被飓风海伦（Helene）—淹没的地区以及米尔顿（Milton） —    —  位于房主必须购买洪水保险的区域之外。【原文：

Many areas inundated by Hurricane Helene — and in the path of Milton — sit outside the zones where homeowners are required to buy flood insurance. 

】

item.title: 法国即将向南部非洲发放第二笔气候贷款
item.description: 法国即将根据 "公正能源转型伙伴关系 "计划向南非财政部发放第二笔贷款。【原文：France is nearing the disbursement of a second loan to South Africa’s Treasury under the Just Energy Transition Partnership program.】

item.title: 飓风 "柯克 "余波横扫欧洲，法国进入戒备状态
item.description: 本周三，飓风柯克的余波将经过法国，法国正准备应对暴雨和洪水。【原文：France is bracing for heavy rain and flooding as the remnants of Hurricane Kirk pass over the country on Wednesday.】

item.title: 海伦背后的海洋热量因气候变化而增加 500 倍的可能性
item.description:
由 20 多名研究人员组成的研究小组通过快速分析发现，燃烧化石燃料加剧了致命飓风的强度。【原文：

A rapid analysis by a group of more than 20 researchers found burning fossil fuels added to the deadly hurricane’s intensity.

】

item.title: 随着可再生能源的发展，全球排放量可能已达到顶峰
item.description: 一份新的报告称，全球因排放而导致的窒息比以往任何时候都严重，但从明年开始，随着太阳能电池板和电池的成本挤掉煤炭，并阻碍石油的增长，这一趋势将发生逆转。【原文：The world is choking from emissions more than ever but that trend is set to reverse starting next year as the cost of solar panels and batteries crowd out coal and stunt the growth of oil, a new report says.】

item.title: 英国气候变化顾问聘请 Pinchbeck 领导净零排放工作
item.description: 艾玛-平奇贝克（Emma Pinchbeck）被任命为英国气候变化委员会的新负责人，该委员会负责就如何实现净零排放目标向政府提供建议。【原文：Emma Pinchbeck was appointed the new head of the UK’s Climate Change Committee, which advises the government on how to meet its net-zero goals.】

item.title: 巴西乙醇公司碳捕集项目进入下一阶段
item.description: 巴西最大的乙醇生产商之一表示，它将继续开展下一阶段的碳捕集项目，该项目耗资约 4.6 亿雷亚尔（8300 万美元），旨在提供该公司声称的首批负碳排放乙醇。【原文：One of Brazil’s top ethanol producers said it will proceed with the next stage of a roughly 460 million reais ($83 million) carbon capture project to supply what the company claims will be the first negative carbon-emission ethanol.】
